summary: This is an email or memo dated August 8, 2019, reporting on a complaint from inmate Jeffrey Epstein regarding his phone call privileges and missing books after being moved from suicide watch back to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who is complaining about his PAC phone number, limited speaker phone calls, and missing books after being moved from suicide watch back to the SHU.

persons.name: Chief Psychologist
persons.context: The recipient or author of this correspondence, affiliated with the U.S. Department of Justice/Federal Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Epstein's Complaints from SHU
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein, while incarcerated, reports to a writer that he has received his PAC number for phone calls but has only had a couple of calls over speaker phone, questioning if that counts as his monthly contact. He also reports missing books he was reading while in suicide watch prior to returning to the SHU.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was an inmate in federal custody as of August 8, 2019.
Epstein had been moved from a suicide watch area back to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
Epstein complained about limited phone call access, having only had 'a couple of phone calls over the speaker phone' and questioning if that counted toward his monthly allowance.
Epstein reported that books he was reading while in suicide watch were missing after his transfer to the SHU.
The correspondence is addressed to or from a Chief Psychologist at the U.S. Department of Justice/Federal Bureau of Prisons.
